result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Richard D. Roloff was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: shall be installed on any motor vehicle owned and/or operated by defendant.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay fine, costs, blood draw fee and DNA surcharge through the Dodge County Clerk of Courts office. Defendant to set up a payment plan within 60 days (1/19/16) if needed.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.

Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license.
Defendant must attend and comply with the terms of Alcohol Treatment Court if he qualifies. Probation Review Hearing set 12/3/15 at 3:00 p.m. in Br. 2.

Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.  Defendant shall successfully attend an OWI Victim Impact Panel within 120 days of conviction.

timeConds.notes:
in Dodge County Jail with Huber and Transfer to commence immediately.
Consecutive to: any other sentence previously imposed

(3:27) Defendant Richard D. Roloff in court, in custody w/o counsel. No appearance for the State of Wisconsin.  Alcohol Court Coordinator appears. Agent Stacey Humlie and Rob Deglow appears. Defendant appears in person. Discussion held. Def. is serving a new sentence; will be terminated from ATC shortly. Def. remanded

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
(9:12) Defendant Richard D. Roloff in court, in custody with attorney Robert Franklin Nagel.  Gilbert G. Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Nagel heard on status - Def. is on PO hold from OWI3rd in 13CT264 and heard on reasons, dirty UAs; Court orders case set for JT; Def. had revocation hearing yesterday, has revocation of alcohol court; discussion on State's recomm.; recess taken for Atty. Nagel to speak with client; Def. will plead; State heard on recomm.; Court reviews charge/penalties; Def. pleads Guilty to OWI4th; Court reviews GPQPA & WOR; Def. is being treated for mental illness; Def. requests Court waive waiting period for occupational, Court denies; Court finds plea made FVK&I and finds Def. guilty of OWI4th w/BAC dismissed; State heard (Def. has been on PO hold for 54 days); Atty. Nagel heard; Def. makes statement; Court imposes sentence; Def. remanded

**W/H - 3 years PO
- 180 days in DCJ w/H&Tr. comm. immediately
- $600 F+C = $1,449.00 paid through Cof C
- $250 DNA surcharge and sample
- $33.60 blood draw - Hartford
- AODA & VIP w/in 120 days
- absolute sobriety, no bars
- not drive w/o valid DL
- ATC if eligible by Br. 2: 12/3/15 at 3pm in Br. 2

9:02 - Defendant Richard D. Roloff in court with attorney Greg E. Vollan.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested waiving time limits. Prelim set. Court sets bond at $1000 PA bond  with conditions:   Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not be in a motor vehicle operated by anyone under the influence of any intoxicant.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
